revised_title: The Vertebrate Fauna and Environmental History of the Norwich Crag at Bramerton
tldr: The authors studied the vertebrate fauna and environmental history of Bramerton, a type locality for the Norwich Crag in Norfolk, England. They analyzed foraminifer, mollusc, and pollen samples from the area and found that the marine sediments were deposited under both temperate and colder conditions. The findings suggest that the temperate stage at Bramerton represents a new stage in the East Anglian Pleistocene succession, called the Bramertonian, while the subsequent cold stage is equivalent to the Pre-Pastonian substage of the Norfolk coast.
